snippet: With a playoff spot on the line, the teams combined to draw the best overnight rating of any Sunday prime-time N.F.L. broadcast in 13 years.
abstract: With a playoff spot on the line, the teams combined to draw the best overnight rating of any Sunday prime-time N.F.L. broadcast in 13 years.
lead_paragraph: The combination of an N.F.L. division rivalry game between the Dallas Cowboys and the New York Giants with playoff implications for both teams and a lack of competition from other broadcast networks worked strongly in NBC's favor on Sunday. Preliminary overnight Nielsen estimates suggest that the game -- won by the Giants, 31-14 -- was not only the highest-rated "Sunday Night Football" game since the program moved to NBC in 2006, but that it also had the best overnight rating of any Sunday prime-time N.F.L. broadcast in 13 years. It barely beat the ratings for this season's Week 1 game between the Cowboys and the New York Jets.

headline.main: Giants and Cowboys Lift NBC in Ratings
